SEARCH
Package com.mjh.innaxyswebapp.model

Class Graph

java.lang.Object
com.mjh.innaxyswebapp.model.Graph
@Component public class Graph extends Object
Class which represents a graph. The graph itself contains both the edges and nodes which construct the entire graph. As it is typical for the graph to be undirected and weighted, an adjacency list is also constructed on initialisation so as to find the neighbouring nodes of each node within the graph itself. Various getters and setters are available so as to provide specific information pertaining to the graph. Node, Edge, and Timer can be reviewed to find further information regarding the classes.
Since:
02-10-2023
Version:
1.0
Author:
MaxMJH - MaxHarrisMJH@gmail.com

  • Constructor Details

    • Graph

      public Graph(List<Node> nodes, List<Edge> edges)
      Overloaded constructor which initialises an edge with a source and target node with a set distance. Constructor which initialises a graph based on the passed edges and nodes. This constructor will also generate an adjacency list.
      Parameters:
      nodes - The list containing nodes.
      edges - The list containing edges.

  • Method Details

    • createAdjacencyList

      public void createAdjacencyList()
      This method creates an adjacency list pertaining to the graph. It is expected that each node within the graph will have their respected neighbours as well as their distances.

    • calculateShortestPaths

      public Map<Node,Node> calculateShortestPaths(Node source)
      This method calculates the shortest path from the source to all other nodes within the graph. This uses Dijkstra's Shortest Path algorithm to determine the shortest paths based on the source. To calculate the total time taken to find all shortest paths, at the start and end of the method, the times are recorded.
      Parameters:
      source - The node within the graph that represents the node of interest.
      Returns:
      A mapping of each node within the graph alongside their neighbours, based on their distances.

    • getShortestPath

      public List<Node> getShortestPath(Map<Node,Node> shortestPaths, Node source, Node target)
      This method calculates the shortest path between the specified source and target node within the graph. Once the shortest distance from source to target is found, the outcome is reversed to represent to represent source to target, rather than target to source. To calculate the total time taken to find all shortest paths, at the start and end of the method, the times are recorded.
      Parameters:
      shortestPaths - The shortest path to each node from the source.
      source - The source node (starting point).
      target - The target node (ending point).
      Returns:
      A list of nodes equating to the shortest path applicable from source to target.

    • getPathMetadata

      public ShortestPath getPathMetadata(List<Node> path)
      This method is used to find the shortest path metadata, such as the total distance, total amount of edges, and the overall time taken to find the shortest path.
      Parameters:
      path - A list containing the shortest path from the source node to the target node.
      Returns:
      An instance of ShortestPath containing path metadata.

    • getNodes

      public List<Node> getNodes()
      Method to return all nodes within the graph.
      Returns:
      All nodes within the graph.

    • setNodes

      public void setNodes(List<Node> nodes)
      Method which sets the nodes within the graph, note that if this is done, the adjacency matrix should be re-constructed.
      Parameters:
      nodes - Nodes that should be used in the graph.

    • getEdges

      public List<Edge> getEdges()
      Method to return all edges within the graph.
      Returns:
      All edges within the graph.

    • setEdges

      public void setEdges(List<Edge> edges)
      Method which sets the edges within the graph, note that if this is done, the adjacency matrix should be re-constructed.
      Parameters:
      edges - Edges that should be used in the graph.

    • getAdjacencyList

      Method to return the adjacency list of the graph.
      Returns:
      The adjacency list of the graph.

    • setAdjacencyList

      public void setAdjacencyList(Map<Node,Map<Node,Integer>> adjacencyList)
      Method which sets the adjacency list of the graph, ensure that the adjacency list correctly matches that of the nodes and their edges.
      Parameters:
      adjacencyList - The new adjacency list for the graph.

    • getTimer
